meanings.definition: Anosmias: plural form of anosmia, the loss of the sense of smell.
meanings.sent1: Some people experience anosmias after a bad cold, making it hard for them to smell anything.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study anosmias to understand how the sense of smell works in the human body.
meanings.sent3: The anosmias in the house were so severe that they mistook the smell of pizza for burnt toast.
meanings.sent4: The anosmias in the city were like a thick fog, obscuring all scents from reaching the residents.
meanings.sent5: The anosmias in the forest were so intense that even the strongest odors went unnoticed.
